Procurement Category Manager

Company Name La Trobe University Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 7 days ago Number of views 260 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Procurement Category Manager


  • Full Time; Continuing role based in Bundoora (Melbourne)
  • $108,052 - $114,576 per annum plus up to 17% superannuation

The Strategic Procurement Directorate team is responsible for effective strategic sourcing and procurement at LaTrobe. The Directorate is accountable for all phases of the procurement category management process from identification of business needs, procurement strategy development, strategy execution, contract management and contract closure.


Reporting to the Director, Strategic Procurement this position will be responsible for the Infrastructure and Operations (I&O) category ensuring the delivery of quality procurement strategy, integrity of procurement governance, and associated process data management and reporting.


The candidate


To succeed, you will possess/demonstrate:


  • Experience and expertise in the field of procurement category management, or postgraduate qualifications and extensive relevant experience;
  • Ability to effectively develop, communicate and present robust business case and / or procurement strategy proposals;
  • The ability to consistently and positively engage with a broad range of stakeholders delivering high quality strategic procurement support, advice and results.
  • Proven experience in the execution of a variety of transparent, ethical and commercially competitive procurement processes.

Closing date: 11pm Thursday 20th September 2018


Position Enquiries: Andrew Peacock, TEL: 03 9479 5886 Email: a.peacock@latrobe.edu.au


\xa0PD HEO9 Procurement Category Manager.pdf


This position is open to people with a valid full-time working visa.



Please address Key Selection Criteria and attach these with your application.


Please scroll down to apply.


*************************************


La Trobe University is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


\xa0All La Trobe University employees are bound by the Working with Children Act 2005.\xa0 If you are successful, you will be required to hold a valid Victorian Employee Working with Children Check prior to commencement.


For further enquiries on how to apply for this role, please contact Senior Recruitment Business Partner Justin Bolton on +61 (03) 9479 1073


To apply and to view position description please visit http://www.latrobe.edu.au/jobs and search for job number 557216 under current vacancies.


About La Trobe


La Trobe University’s success is driven by people who are committed to making a difference. They are creative and highly motivated, pursue new ideas and create knowledge. La Trobe is one of Australia’s research leaders, and the largest provider of higher education to regional Victoria. La Trobe University turned 50 in 2017, and over the half century of its existence it has established a reputation as an innovative and accessible university, willing to take risks and take on challenges.\xa0 Our teaching and research address some of the most significant issues of our time and we’re passionate about driving change through operational excellence to benefit the communities we serve.

AU-Technical Specialist

Company Name Apple Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 143 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

After customers purchase our products, you’re the one who helps them get more out of their new Apple technology. Your day in the Apple Store is filled with a range of focused support and service tasks. Whether you’re helping customers get started with the Mac or finding answers to their questions about other Apple devices, you’re ready to share knowledge and provide exceptional assistance. You gain satisfaction from bringing resolution and insight to each customer, elevating his or her relationship with Apple to the next level.

Description

As a Technical Specialist, you help new owners get started and current ones get quick, efficient support — developing strong, positive relationships with Apple. When a customer needs assistance, you quickly assess their situation. Sometimes you take care of customers with advice or a solution on the spot, using your knowledge of current Apple technology to help with iPod, iPhone and iPad devices. At other times, you refer customers to Support team members who get them up and running again. You even provide personal training for new customers, helping them acquire the basic skills they need to get started on photo, video and music projects. The entire store team benefits from your commitment to providing the best care for customers. By helping Apple maintain strong relationships with customers, you are instrumental to our success.

Key Qualifications

Ability to assess customers’ support needs when they arrive, then provide solutions or refer them to other team members
Flexibility to regularly rotate through different technical specialities and skill sets
Ability to thrive on change as products evolve

Additional Requirements
  • You have excellent time management skills and can make decisions quickly.
  • You maintain composure and customer focus while troubleshooting and solving issues.
  • You reassure customers when delivering product diagnoses and potential solutions.
JobID: AUSSS

  • Apparel & Fashion
  • Retail

Mobile Plant Operator

Company Name GOLD FIELDS Company Location Laverton, Australia

Posted Date Posted 6 days ago Number of views 108 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Role Details

Gold Fields Australia is currently seeking an Operator: Mobile Plant to join their Processing department at Granny Smith Gold Mine. This role is offered on an 8 days on, 6 days off, 7 nights on, 7 days off roster and is FIFO from Perth.

Reporting to the Supervisor: Process, you will be responsible for the safe, secure and efficient operation of different mobile plant machinery.

Key Responsibilities Will Include
  • Always act in a manner that seeks to enhance the safety culture and performance of GFA and ensures that the Vital Behaviours are adhered to at all times.
  • Maintain a high level of health, safety and environmental awareness and comply with all relevant policies and procedures
  • Maximise return on assets through effective utilisation and prompt identification and diagnosis of items on the plant that require preventative maintenance or repair.
  • Carry out statutory workplace inspections and monitor other employees and contractors in their tasks.
  • Ensure all records for the operation of mobile equipment are accurately maintained.
  • Assessing potential hazards and making the necessary changes to eliminate or control them.

Key factors to your success include;
  • Experience in working in rural areas and autonomously
  • Minimum 5years’ experience in operating heavy mobile equipment especially using a digger loader combination machine
  • Possess a current “HR” WA Driver’s License
  • Apply First Aid, Dogging and Confined Space tickets are desirable
  • Strong verbal communication skills
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

Interested parties should submit a detailed curriculum vitae to: https://careers.goldfields.com.au

Gold Fields is committed to the achievement and maintenance of diversity and equity in employment. We are committed to achieving a diverse and inclusive workforce, and strongly encourage applications from Female, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates .

Entry level

  • Mining & Metals
  • Oil & Energy

  • Manufacturing

Job description

Company
\xa0\xa0
An impressive international company with a long history in developing, financing and building Renewable Energy assets globally with several GWs of operating Solar & Wind Farms. The company is building out a portfolio in Australia and has ambitious growth strategies with several projects in construction that will soon move into operations.
\xa0
Position
\xa0
This position offers a broad range of responsibilities and, as a newly created position, provides you the opportunity to make it your own. You will drive asset management of an allocated portfolio of Solar & Wind Farms and have manage a small team (1-2 currently) of site based HV Operators.
\xa0
Specific responsibilities will include:
  • Supervision of O&M works and all planned maintenance as well as reacting to unplanned outages
  • Contract administration of project contracts including Planning, PPA & Grid Connection agreements and ensuring contract obligations are met
  • Ongoing reporting to debt providers and investors on Plant Performance
  • Leadership of site-based HV Operators and lead all escalated issues as well as reviewing and analysing HV testing results
  • Coordinating bids & market settlements with 3rd party providers


You
  • Electrical Engineering degree preferred
  • Operations and Maintenance of Renewable Energy power plants (Wind and/or Solar)
  • Basic contract administration / contract management experience and the ability to understand terms and obligations under contract
  • Proven experience interfacing with AEMO & NSPs re grid compliance and Grid Codes


Next Step
\xa0\xa0
To be considered please click through the APPLY link attaching your resume in word format. To set up a confidential conversation ahead of your application and to understand further details of the role please email rhauville@phillipriley.com.au
